metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5044 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in libgfortran might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (Fortran application crash) via vectors related to array allocation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpp-4.8 - 4.8.4-2ubuntu1~14.04
g++-4.8 - 4.8.4-2ubuntu1~14.04
g++-4.8-multilib - 4.8.4-2ubuntu1~14.04

notes.Note: sbeattie> issues are in libgfortran/fortran runtime gcc-avr only builds gcc and g++ compilers/runtimes gcc-X.X-cross packages have fortran compiler/runtimes in universe gcc-XX-defaults packages do not actually include gcc, just symlinks to the default version to use per release/arch/tool gccgo packages are (surprise!) only interested in go runtimes gcc-opt is a wrapper for setting gcc arguments eslerm> addressed in gcc-5.1.0 by 92e6f3a43ec ("Introduce xmallocarray, an overflow checking variant of xmalloc.")

criterions.comment: gcc-4.7 package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-4.7-armel-cross package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-4.7-armhf-cross package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-4.8 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.4-2ubuntu1~14.04').
gcc-4.8-arm64-cross package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2').
gcc-4.8-armhf-cross package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2').
gcc-4.8-powerpc-cross package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2').
gcc-4.8-ppc64el-cross package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2').
gcc-4.9 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9.1-4ubuntu1').
gcc-arm-linux-androideabi package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-mingw-w64 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '16').
gcc-snapshot package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20140715-0ubuntu1').
